libraryObject.name: URL Filtering
libraryObject.description: URL Filtering: The method of blocking sites by categories, including the use of Dynamic Content Classification (DCC).

list.name: Executives: Allowed Hosts, Domains, or URLs (SmartMatch)
CloudStorage: Allowed Users or Groups
list.description: This list of user or group names will be allowed to Exception: Categories. If the rules are prefixed, you may use DOMAIN\USERNAME notation.

list.name: URL Filter: Override Blocked Categories
list.description: Exempt categories override the block when a site has multiple categories. This overrides the default blocked categories below this rule. For example if a site is on both Education and Sexual Material, putting Education here, will allow the site even if it's blocked by the Sexual Materials category.

list.name: URL Filter: Default Blocked Categories
list.description: These categories are always blocked for everyone unless an exception is made above this block. The default selected ones are just eamples. Modify them to conform to your policy.

list.name: CloudStorage: Allowed Hosts, Domains, or URLs (SmartMatch)
POLICYNAME: Allowed Hosts, Domains, or URLs (SmartMatch)
POLICYNAME: Allowed Users or Groups
list.description: This list of user or group names will be allowed to Exception: Categories. If the rules are prefixed, you may use DOMAIN\USERNAME notation.

list.name: SafeSearch: Bypass Sites
list.description: SmartList of Sites to bypass SafeSearch Enforcement. There are instances where SafeSearch may break certain sections of a site. SmartList entries are in the form of Host, Domain, URL, or Fragment. host.domain.tld, domain.tld, http://host.domain.tld/path?parameters, domain.tld/path (* assumed on both sides of the entry)

list.name: URL Filter: Allowed Sites
list.description: SmartList of Hosts, Domains, or URLs to always allow. SmartList entries are in the form of Host, Domain, URL, or Fragment. host.domain.tld, domain.tld, http://host.domain.tld/path?parameters, domain.tld/path (* assumed on both sides of the entry)

list.name: URL Filter: Blocked Sites
list.description: SmartList of Hosts, Domains, or URLs to always block. SmartList entries are in the form of Host, Domain, URL, or Fragment. host.domain.tld, domain.tld, http://host.domain.tld/path?parameters, domain.tld/path (* assumed on both sides of the entry)

list.name: SocialNetworking: Allowed Categories
list.description: SocialNetworking: Users and Groups will be allowed to these categories. Example: Social Networking, Dating/Personals

list.name: WebMail: Allowed Categories
list.description: WebMail: Users and Groups will be allowed to these categories. Example: Social Networking, Dating/Personals

list.name: Executives: Allowed Categories
list.description: Executives: Users and Groups will be allowed to these categories. Example: Social Networking, Dating/Personals

list.name: SocialNetworking: Allowed Users or Groups
list.description: This list of user or group names will be allowed to Exception: Categories. If the rules are prefixed, you may use DOMAIN\USERNAME notation.

list.name: CloudStorage: Allowed Categories
list.description: CloudStorage: Users and Groups will be allowed to these categories. Example: Social Networking, Dating/Personals

configuration.name: URL Blocked
configuration.description: Configuration for a block action of url filter.

ruleGroup.name: URL Filtering
ruleGroup.description: URL Filtering: The method of blocking sites by categories, including the use of Dynamic Content Classification (DCC).

rule.name: DCC: Disable Dynamic Content Classifier
rule.description: In wizard mode, this stops the processing of URL filtering in Response Cycle because the wizard cannot change a checkmark in the rule set criteria.

rule.name: DCC: Enable Dynamic Content Classification
rule.description: When this rule is enabled, content returned from site will be categorized by the DCC engine. If this rule is disabled, uncheck the Response Cycle checkmark in the URL Filtering rule set.

rule.name: DCC: X-DCC-Categories Header
rule.description: This is used in the log to determine if the category was computed by DCC. If DCC is disabled, then disable this rule as well.

listContentEditor.description: This list of users and group names will be allowed to sites and categories below regardless of default policy
This list client IP ranges will be allowed to sites and categories below regardless of default policy
This list of Categories will be allowed for Users, Groups and IPs above regardless of default policy

checkBox.title: Allow Uncategorized URLs
checkBox.description: Allow uncategorized URLs for users, groups and IPs above regardless of the default poliicy

grid.separator: Exception Whitelist Hosts, Domains, and URLs

listContentEditor.description: This smart list of Hosts, Domains and URLs will be allowed for Users, Groups and IPs above regardless of default policy

checkBox.title: Safe Search
checkBox.description: Enable safe search for exceptions. Safe Search setting in Default Policy will apply to requests that do not match the exceptions lists.

checkBox.title: Enable GTI Web Reputation
checkBox.description: Block exceptions with medium or high risk reputations. GTI reputation setting in Default Policy will apply to requests that do not match the exceptions lists.

rule.name: POLICYNAME: Allowed Hosts, Domains, or URLs (SmartMatch)
rule.description: SmartList of Hosts, Domains, or URLs to always allow. SmartList entries are in the form of Host, Domain, URL, or Fragment. host.domain.tld, domain.tld, http://host.domain.tld/path?parameters, domain.tld/path (* assumed on both sides of the entry)

rule.name: Allow Uncategorized URLs
rule.description: This rule allows all URLs that are uncategorized by the GTI web database.

rule.name: Block URLs With Bad Reputation
rule.description: Blocks URLs with bad reputation.

ruleGroup.name: Default: URL Filtering

listContentEditor.title: Allowed Sites
listContentEditor.description: SmartList of Hosts, Domains, or URLs to always allow.

listContentEditor.title: Blocked Sites
listContentEditor.description: SmartList of Hosts, Domains, or URLs to always block.

checkBox.title: Enable Category Filtering
checkBox.description: This applies to all traffic. Exceptions are located on the Next page.

listContentEditor.title: Default Blocked Categories
listContentEditor.description: List of Categories blocked for everyone.

listContentEditor.title: Override Blocked Categories
listContentEditor.description: Override Blocked Categories When site has two categories, these categories override the blocked categories.

checkBox.title: Enable Global Threat Intelligence (GTI) Web Reputation
checkBox.description: Block sites with a Medium or High Risk Reputation.

settingEditor.title: URL Filter Engine Setting
settingEditor.description: Adjust the URL Filtering Engine setting.

listContentEditor.title: SafeSearch Bypass Sites
listContentEditor.description: SmartList of sites to bypass SafeSearch Enforcement.

settingEditor.title: SafeSearch settings
settingEditor.description: Set the sensitivity level for SafeSearch enforcement.

ruleGroup.description: Default policy applies to all users unless an Exception rule set is reached above this one.

rule.name: URL Filter: Allowed Sites
rule.description: Domains or URLs in these lists are always allowed for everyone and not blocked by category.

rule.name: URL Filter: Blocked Sites
rule.description: Domains or URLs in these lists are always blocked for everyone.

rule.name: SafeSearch: Strict and SafeSearch: Bypass Sites
rule.description: SafeSearch Enforcer is set to Strict. There are some rare instances where SafeSearch may need to be bypassed for specific URLs in order to fix some applications.

rule.name: GTI: Block HighRisk and MediumRisk Reputations
rule.description: Blocks urls with bad reputation.

rule.name: URL Filter: Override Blocked Categories
rule.description: Categories that override a block if site is in multiple categories.

rule.name: URL Filter: Default Blocked Categories
rule.description: This is the default list of categories that are blocked for everyone. Anyone needing access to these categories should be defined as a Stop Rule Set exception above this rule.
